page.title: 11PITTINGTON HILL (cont. 2)
page.content:
JULY-buttercup, cow parsley, clover, white dead nettle, daisy,Herb Robert, dog rose, bladder campion, plantain, wild stawberry, white campion, vetch, spotted orchid, early purple orchid, dog daisy, ragwort, milk wort, rock rose, chickweed, yarrow, heath speedwell, forget_me_not, sorrell, nipplewort, hawkweed, wild thyme, Herb Bennet.
Pittington Hill has always been a dominant feature both physically and socially in the life of the villagers of Pittington.In the 1920's it was a central point for meetings both religous and political. Today it offers very pleasant walks and at Easter time an obvious choice for a pace egg track.It is however once again under some threat from the quarrying of the magnesium limestone.
